intro: Tarenna nilagirica, commonly known as Nilagiri tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
